H0.text: Red giant is the stage in the life cycle of stars in which stars spend most of their lifetime, as identified by scientists who have studied the specific stages.

H1.text: Black dwarf is the stage in the life cycle of stars that scientists have studied and found to be where stars spend most of their lifetime.

H2.text: White dwarf is the stage in the life cycle of stars that scientists have studied in which stars spend most of their lifetime.

H3.text: The main sequence is the stage in the life cycle of stars during which stars spend most of their lifetime.

A4.text: Stars spend the majority of their lives on the main sequence, during which core hydrogen burning is dominant.

A5.text: Thus, about 90% of the observed stars above 0.5 Mâ˜‰ will be on the main sequence.
